meanings.definition: To take the place of someone or something
meanings.sent1: In the play, the new actor displaces the old one in the lead role.
meanings.sent2: The substitute teacher displaces the regular teacher when she is sick.
meanings.sent3: The clever robot displaces the human worker, causing chaos in the factory.
meanings.sent4: The rising star displaces the veteran actor from the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The young prince displaces the aging king, bringing new energy to the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To force someone or something to leave their usual place or position
meanings.sent1: The flood displaces families from their homes every year.
meanings.sent2: Construction work may displace wildlife from their natural habitats.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat displaces the dog from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind displaces the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise displaces the birds from the trees, creating a moment of silence.
